action.action-desc: Mrs. Comstock (for herself, Mr. Yoder, and Mr. Cicilline) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the child tax credit.

subsection.text: Section 24(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $1,000 and inserting $2,000.

subsection.header: Increase in dollar threshold at which credit phase-Out begins

paragraph.text: Section 24(b)(2) of such Code is amendedâ€”

subparagraph.text: by striking $110,000 in subparagraph (A) and inserting $150,000;
by striking $75,000 in subparagraph (B) and inserting $100,000; and
by striking $55,000 in subparagraph (C) and inserting 75,000.

paragraph.text: Section 24(b) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Increase in threshold amount based on number of qualifying children
paragraph.text: In the case of a taxpayer with two or more qualifying children, the threshold amount otherwise determined under paragraph (2) shall be increased by $15,000 for each qualifying child of the taxpayer in excess of the first such child.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
